snippet: The party’s leadership did not explain the underlying reasons for the change, but the ouster appeared to be part of a struggle for power.
abstract: Thura Shwe Mann is removed as head of Myanmar's governing Union Solidarity and Development Party in what some describe as coup; Shwe Mann is thought to have lost favor of nation's conservative military elite by forming informal alliance with opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi; Shwe Mann was seen as leading presidential candidate ahead of coming elections.

byline.contributor: Wai Moe contributed reporting from Yangon, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: The party’s leadership did not explain the underlying reasons for the change, but the ouster appeared to be part of a struggle for power.

headline.main: Conservatives in Myanmar Force Out Leader of Ruling Party
headline.print_headline: Conservatives in Myanmar Force Out Leader of Ruling Party

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
